refnamediv.refpurpose: proxy objects for Telepathy media streaming

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This module provides access to the auxiliary objects used to implement TpSvcChannelTypeStreamedMedia.

refsect2.title: tp_media_session_handler_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpMediaSessionHandler * tp_media_session_handler_new (TpDBusDaemon *dbus, const gchar *unique_name, const gchar *object_path, GError **error);

listitem.simpara: a D-Bus daemon; may not be NULL
the unique name of the connection process; may not be NULL or a well-known name
the object path of the media session handler; may not be NULL
used to indicate the error if NULL is returned
a new media session handler proxy, or NULL on invalid arguments

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_media_session_handler_init_known_interfaces ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_media_session_handler_init_known_interfaces (void);
refsect2.para: Ensure that the known interfaces for TpMediaSessionHandler have been set up. This is done automatically when necessary, but for correct overriding of library interfaces by local extensions, you should call this function before calling tp_proxy_or_subclass_hook_on_interface_add() with first argument TP_TYPE_MEDIA_SESSION_HANDLER.
Since 0.7.32

refsect2.title: TpMediaSessionHandler
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct _TpMediaSessionHandler TpMediaSessionHandler;
refsect2.para: A proxy object for a Telepathy connection manager.
Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: TpMediaSessionHandlerClass
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct _TpMediaSessionHandlerClass TpMediaSessionHandlerClass;
refsect2.para: The class of a TpMediaSessionHandler.
Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_media_stream_handler_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpMediaStreamHandler * tp_media_stream_handler_new (TpDBusDaemon *dbus, const gchar *unique_name, const gchar *object_path, GError **error);

listitem.simpara: a D-Bus daemon; may not be NULL
the unique name of the connection process; may not be NULL or a well-known name
the object path of the media stream handler; may not be NULL
used to indicate the error if NULL is returned
a new media stream handler proxy, or NULL on invalid arguments

refsect2.para: Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: tp_media_stream_handler_init_known_interfaces ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_media_stream_handler_init_known_interfaces (void);
refsect2.para: Ensure that the known interfaces for TpMediaStreamHandler have been set up. This is done automatically when necessary, but for correct overriding of library interfaces by local extensions, you should call this function before calling tp_proxy_or_subclass_hook_on_interface_add() with first argument TP_TYPE_MEDIA_STREAM_HANDLER.
Since 0.7.32

refsect2.title: TpMediaStreamHandler
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct _TpMediaStreamHandler TpMediaStreamHandler;
refsect2.para: A proxy object for a Telepathy connection manager.
Since 0.7.1

refsect2.title: TpMediaStreamHandlerClass
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct _TpMediaStreamHandlerClass TpMediaStreamHandlerClass;
refsect2.para: The class of a TpMediaStreamHandler.
Since 0.7.1

refsect2.condition: deprecated:Use StreamHandler.Error on each StreamHandler object instead.
refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_callback_for_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_session_handler_callback_for_error) (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);

warning.para: tp_cli_media_session_handler_callback_for_error is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use StreamHandler.Error on each StreamHandler object instead.

refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a Error method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.condition: deprecated:Use StreamHandler.Error on each StreamHandler object instead.
refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_call_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_media_session_handler_call_error (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, guint in_Error_Code, const gchar *in_Message, tp_cli_media_session_handler_callback_for_error callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);

warning.para: tp_cli_media_session_handler_call_error is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use StreamHandler.Error on each StreamHandler object instead.

refsect2.para: Start a Error method call.

Informs the connection manager that an error occured in this session. If used, the connection manager must terminate the session and all of the streams within it, and may also emit a <tp:dbus-ref namespace="org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type.StreamedMedia">StreamError</tp:dbus-ref> signal on the channel for each stream within the session.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.condition: deprecated:Use StreamHandler.Error on each StreamHandler object instead.
refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_run_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_session_handler_run_error (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, guint in_Error_Code, const gchar *in_Message, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);

warning.para: tp_cli_media_session_handler_run_error is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use StreamHandler.Error on each StreamHandler object instead.

refsect2.para: Call the method Error and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Informs the connection manager that an error occured in this session. If used, the connection manager must terminate the session and all of the streams within it, and may also emit a <tp:dbus-ref namespace="org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type.StreamedMedia">StreamError</tp:dbus-ref> signal on the channel for each stream within the session.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaSessionHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_callback_for_ready ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_session_handler_callback_for_ready) (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a Ready method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_call_ready ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_media_session_handler_call_ready (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, tp_cli_media_session_handler_callback_for_ready callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a Ready method call.

Inform the connection manager that a client is ready to handle this session handler (i.e. that it has connected to the <tp:member-ref>NewStreamHandler</tp:member-ref> signal and done any other necessary setup).

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_run_ready ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_session_handler_run_ready (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method Ready and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Inform the connection manager that a client is ready to handle this session handler (i.e. that it has connected to the <tp:member-ref>NewStreamHandler</tp:member-ref> signal and done any other necessary setup).

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaSessionHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_signal_callback_new_stream_handler ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_session_handler_signal_callback_new_stream_handler) (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, const gchar *arg_Stream_Handler, guint arg_ID, guint arg_Media_Type, guint arg_Direction, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Represents the signature of a callback for the signal NewStreamHandler.

listitem.simpara: The proxy on which tp_cli_media_session_handler_connect_to_new_stream_handler() was called
The path of a new object implementing the <tp:dbus-ref namespace="org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Media">StreamHandler</tp:dbus-ref> interface.
The unique ID of the new stream
Type of media that this stream should handle
Direction of this stream
User-supplied data
User-supplied weakly referenced object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_session_handler_connect_to_new_stream_handler ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxySignalConnection * tp_cli_media_session_handler_connect_to_new_stream_handler (TpMediaSessionHandler *proxy, tp_cli_media_session_handler_signal_callback_new_stream_handler callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal NewStreamHandler.
Emitted when a new stream handler has been created for this session.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaSessionHandler or subclass
Callback to be called when the signal is received
User-supplied data for the callback
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_codec_choice ()

refsect2.para: Start a CodecChoice method call.
Inform the connection manager of codec used to receive data.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_codec_choice ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_codec_choice (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, guint in_Codec_ID, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method CodecChoice and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.
Inform the connection manager of codec used to receive data.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_error) (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);

NULL on success, or an error on failure

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_error (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, guint in_Error_Code, const gchar *in_Message, tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_error callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a Error method call.

Inform the connection manager that an error occured in this stream. The connection manager should emit the StreamError signal for the stream on the relevant channel, and remove the stream from the session.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: ID of error, from the MediaStreamError enumeration
Used to pass an 'in' argument: String describing the error
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_error ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_error (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, guint in_Error_Code, const gchar *in_Message, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method Error and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Inform the connection manager that an error occured in this stream. The connection manager should emit the StreamError signal for the stream on the relevant channel, and remove the stream from the session.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: ID of error, from the MediaStreamError enumeration
Used to pass an 'in' argument: String describing the error
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL

refsect2.para: Call the method NativeCandidatesPrepared and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.
Informs the connection manager that all possible native candisates have been discovered for the moment.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED

Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)

a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_new_native_candidate ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_new_native_candidate) (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a NewNativeCandidate method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_new_native_candidate ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_new_native_candidate (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const gchar *in_Candidate_ID, const GPtrArray *in_Transports, tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_new_native_candidate callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a NewNativeCandidate method call.
Inform this MediaStreamHandler that a new native transport candidate has been ascertained.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: String identifier for this candidate

Used to pass an 'in' argument: Array of transports for this candidate, with fields:
  • component number
  • IP address (as a string)
  • port
  • base network protocol (one of the values of MediaStreamBaseProto)
  • proto subtype (e.g. RTP)
  • proto profile (e.g. AVP)
  • our preference value of this transport (double in range 0.0-1.0 inclusive); 1 signals the most preferred transport
  • transport type, one of the values of MediaStreamTransportType
  • username if authentication is required
  • password if authentication is required
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_new_native_candidate ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_new_native_candidate (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const gchar *in_Candidate_ID, const GPtrArray *in_Transports, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method NewNativeCandidate and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.
Inform this MediaStreamHandler that a new native transport candidate has been ascertained.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: String identifier for this candidate

Used to pass an 'in' argument: Array of transports for this candidate, with fields:
  • component number
  • IP address (as a string)
  • port
  • base network protocol (one of the values of MediaStreamBaseProto)
  • proto subtype (e.g. RTP)
  • proto profile (e.g. AVP)
  • our preference value of this transport (double in range 0.0-1.0 inclusive); 1 signals the most preferred transport
  • transport type, one of the values of MediaStreamTransportType
  • username if authentication is required
  • password if authentication is required
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

Inform the connection manager that a client is ready to handle this StreamHandler. Also provide it with info about all supported codecs.

the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally-supported codecs.
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.para: Call the method Ready and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.
Inform the connection manager that a client is ready to handle this StreamHandler. Also provide it with info about all supported codecs.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally-supported codecs.
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_set_local_codecs ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_set_local_codecs) (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a SetLocalCodecs method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_set_local_codecs ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_set_local_codecs (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const GPtrArray *in_Codecs, tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_set_local_codecs callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a SetLocalCodecs method call.

Used to provide codecs after Ready(), so the media client can go ready for an incoming call and exchange candidates/codecs before knowing what local codecs are available.

This is useful for gatewaying calls between two connection managers. Given an incoming call, you need to call Ready to get the remote codecs before you can use them as the "local" codecs to place the outgoing call, and hence receive the outgoing call's remote codecs to use as the incoming call's "local" codecs.

In this situation, you would pass an empty list of codecs to the incoming call's Ready method, then later call SetLocalCodecs on the incoming call in order to respond to the offer.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally-supported codecs
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_set_local_codecs ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_set_local_codecs (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const GPtrArray *in_Codecs, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method SetLocalCodecs and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Used to provide codecs after Ready(), so the media client can go ready for an incoming call and exchange candidates/codecs before knowing what local codecs are available.

This is useful for gatewaying calls between two connection managers. Given an incoming call, you need to call Ready to get the remote codecs before you can use them as the "local" codecs to place the outgoing call, and hence receive the outgoing call's remote codecs to use as the incoming call's "local" codecs.

In this situation, you would pass an empty list of codecs to the incoming call's Ready method, then later call SetLocalCodecs on the incoming call in order to respond to the offer.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally-supported codecs
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

Informs the connection manager of the stream's current state, as as specified in Channel.Type.StreamedMedia::ListStreams.

Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: (Undocumented)
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED

NULL on success, or an error on failure

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_supported_codecs ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_supported_codecs (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const GPtrArray *in_Codecs, tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_supported_codecs callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a SupportedCodecs method call.

Inform the connection manager of the supported codecs for this session. This is called after the connection manager has emitted SetRemoteCodecs to notify what codecs are supported by the peer, and will thus be an intersection of all locally supported codecs (passed to Ready) and those supported by the peer.

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally supported codecs.
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.para: Call the method SupportedCodecs and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Inform the connection manager of the supported codecs for this session. This is called after the connection manager has emitted SetRemoteCodecs to notify what codecs are supported by the peer, and will thus be an intersection of all locally supported codecs (passed to Ready) and those supported by the peer.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally supported codecs.
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

User-supplied data for the callback
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_connect_to_set_remote_codecs ()

refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal SetRemoteCodecs.

Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes to inform the client of the codecs supported by the remote end. If these codecs are compatible with the remote codecs, then the client must call <tp:member-ref>SupportedCodecs</tp:member-ref>, otherwise call <tp:member-ref>Error</tp:member-ref>.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_connect_to_set_stream_playing ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxySignalConnection * tp_cli_media_stream_handler_connect_to_set_stream_playing (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, tp_cli_media_stream_handler_signal_callback_set_stream_playing callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal SetStreamPlaying.

If emitted with argument TRUE, this means that the connection manager wishes to set the stream playing; this means that the streaming implementation should expect to receive data. If emitted with argument FALSE this signal is basically meaningless and should be ignored. <tp:rationale> We're very sorry. </tp:rationale>

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass

user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_unhold_failure ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_unhold_failure) (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a UnholdFailure method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_connect_to_set_stream_held ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxySignalConnection * tp_cli_media_stream_handler_connect_to_set_stream_held (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, tp_cli_media_stream_handler_signal_callback_set_stream_held callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Connect a handler to the signal SetStreamHeld.

Emitted when the connection manager wishes to place the stream on hold (so the streaming client should free hardware or software resources) or take the stream off hold (so the streaming client should reacquire the necessary resources).

When placing a channel's streams on hold, the connection manager SHOULD notify the remote contact that this will be done (if appropriate in the protocol) before it emits this signal.

It is assumed that relinquishing a resource will not fail. If it does, the call is probably doomed anyway.

When unholding a channel's streams, the connection manager SHOULD emit this signal and wait for success to be indicated via HoldState before it notifies the remote contact that the channel has been taken off hold.

This means that if a resource is unavailable, the remote contact will never even be told that we tried to acquire it.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Callback to be called when the signal is received
User-supplied data for the callback
Destructor for the user-supplied data, which will be called when this signal is disconnected, or before this function returns NULL
If not NULL, used to raise an error if NULL is returned
a TpProxySignalConnection containing all of the above, which can be used to disconnect the signal; or NULL if the proxy does not have the desired interface or has become invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_hold_state ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_hold_state (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, gboolean in_Held, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method HoldState and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.
Notify the connection manager that the stream's hold state has been changed successfully in response to SetStreamHeld.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: If true, the stream is now on hold.
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_unhold_failure ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_cli_media_stream_handler_run_unhold_failure (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, GError **error, GMainLoop **loop);
refsect2.para: Call the method UnholdFailure and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.
Notify the connection manager that an attempt to reacquire the necessary hardware or software resources to unhold the stream, in response to SetStreamHeld, has failed.

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_signal_callback_set_stream_held ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_stream_handler_signal_callback_set_stream_held) (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gboolean arg_Held, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Represents the signature of a callback for the signal SetStreamHeld.

listitem.simpara: The proxy on which tp_cli_media_stream_handler_connect_to_set_stream_held() was called
If true, the stream is to be placed on hold.
User-supplied data
User-supplied weakly referenced object

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_codecs_updated ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpProxyPendingCall * tp_cli_media_stream_handler_call_codecs_updated (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, gint timeout_ms, const GPtrArray *in_Codecs, tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_codecs_updated callback, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Start a CodecsUpdated method call.

Inform the connection manager that the parameters of the supported codecs for this session have changed. The connection manager should send the new parameters to the remote contact. <tp:rationale> This is required for H.264 and Theora, for example. </tp:rationale>

listitem.simpara: the TpProxy
the timeout in milliseconds, or -1 to use the default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally supported codecs, which SHOULD be the same as were previously in effect, but possibly with different parameters.
user-supplied data passed to the callback; must be NULL if callback is NULL
If not NULL, a GObject which will be weakly referenced; if it is destroyed, this call will automatically be cancelled. Must be NULL if callback is NULL
a TpProxyPendingCall representing the call in progress. It is borrowed from the object, and will become invalid when the callback is called, the call is cancelled or the TpProxy becomes invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_codecs_updated ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_cli_media_stream_handler_callback_for_codecs_updated) (TpMediaStreamHandler *proxy, const GError *error, gpointer user_data, GObject *weak_object);
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback called when a CodecsUpdated method call succeeds or fails.

listitem.simpara: the proxy on which the call was made
NULL on success, or an error on failure
user-supplied data
user-supplied object

refsect2.para: Call the method CodecsUpdated and run the main loop until it returns. Before calling this method, you must add a reference to any borrowed objects you need to keep, and generally ensure that everything is in a consistent state.

Inform the connection manager that the parameters of the supported codecs for this session have changed. The connection manager should send the new parameters to the remote contact. <tp:rationale> This is required for H.264 and Theora, for example. </tp:rationale>

listitem.simpara: A TpMediaStreamHandler or subclass
Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for default
Used to pass an 'in' argument: Locally supported codecs, which SHOULD be the same as were previously in effect, but possibly with different parameters.
If not NULL, used to return errors if FALSE is returned

If not NULL, set before re-entering the main loop, to point to a GMainLoop which can be used to cancel this call with g_main_loop_quit(), causing a return of FALSE with error set to TP_DBUS_ERROR_CANCELLED
TRUE on success, FALSE and sets error on error
